Sammi.I am so sorry to hear that life is being so difficult for you.  I was diagnosed with RA 2 years ago and I started treatment with Plaquenil, that didn't help, went to Methotrexate syringe type, tried Arava, NOTHING was even helping, in fact, it was GETTING WORSE!!!  I asked my general physician for a referral to a new rheumatologist.  That new rheumatologist wanted some labs from me before he would see me.  One of the things he tested me for was hcv.  Lo and behold, the test was positive!  The rheumatologist immediately took me off of all my RA meds and  wanted me to see a gastroenterologist before I saw him.  I did and talked about treatment for my hcv.  The gastroenterologist wanted me to see the rheumatologist before I started treatment.  I did that and the rheumatologist told me that people with hcv often falsley test positive for RA.  He thinks that I DO NOT have RA but rather, just the symptoms frequently associated with hcv!!!  The rheumatologist thinks I do have ostoearthritis because I have some nodules on my fingers and feet that would be associated with that rather than RA.  He also diagnosed me with fibromyalgia and feels that a lot of symptoms are from that, too.  I should also mention that my gastro tested me for cryoglobulenemia which has symptoms which are also very similar to RA.Have you been tested for Cryoglobulenemia?  How do you know that you have RA?  I was told by my rheummy that my pain should improve with successful treatment for my hcv (I am type 1a).Just some food for thought.  I do feel better after stopping treatment for RA so the meds were not doing me ANY good!!You may have a totally different situation but I have heard of many people with hcv being mistakenly diagnosed with RA.If you would like to correspond with me about this you can let me know and I'll trade email addresses with you.Take care and best wishes.Smiles, Sue

hi my name is ruby87 from uk.just found your message boards today.and i cant tell you the relief i have had from reading them.especially this thread.as i went to the doctor for all these tests and tested negative the first time 18 months ago and then again a few months ago.i had purple and red spots and my legs swollen legs and ankles ulcers on my legs and was in agony.this cleared up the first time after a few weeks maybe 5weeks.then it came again as i said a few months ago not as bad as the first time and i got all the tests again which proved negative.but i checked out the web because my doctor was happy to leave things.i saw on the web that people with these symptoms often have hepb or hepc.so i got a lft.which was slighly high.first time gamma gt90 alt54 and then second time gamma gt 80 and alt 95 third time gamma gt 70 alt54.so i got a test called hepseriology because i had had hepb 33 years ago and this was to find out if it had come back.this test finds any other liver viruses.and i tested positive for hepc.i must say though.i changed my diet while all those tests were being done because it tood a good few weeks maybe 6weeks or more for all the tests and waiting on results.i got sandra cabots liver cleansing diet.i didnt stick to it religiously but cut out all dairy foods (except a little milk in tea and coffee.) and cut out sugar and sweets which i was overeating on and eating all the wrong foods instead of meals and my ankles have improved immensly (sorry about spelling) all my joints have improved.saying that though i am still in pain in writs fingers back and most of my skelleton but you wouldnt believe how much i have improved since i changed my diet i would never be able to copewith that level of pain.seeminly its an auto immune reaction trying to clear the virus there is plenty on the web about it.type in auto immune diseases and hepc.but this is the first i'v read from real people.hope this is a help to you.good luck and god bless us all.ruby87
